clinical_study.brief_title: The Value of VOCs Analysis in Exhaled Breath for Pulmonary Benign and Malignant Lesion Diagnosis
clinical_study.official_title: The Value of VOCs Analysis in Exhaled Breath for Pulmonary Benign and Malignant Lesion Diagnosis

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to analysis the volatile organic gases(VOCs) in exhaled breath of pulmonary lesion patients and healthy controls, in order to find the difference of composition and concentration among groups.

detailed_description.textblock: Collect the exhaled gas in pulmonary lesion patients and healthy controls, using proton transfer reaction mass spectrometry to analysis the different composition and concentration of VOCs, to find the biomarker gases of distinguishing benign and malignant lesion of lung among different groups， and try to build a diagnostic model for lung lesion.

primary_outcome.description: It is the measurement result of VOCs in exhaled breath using PTR-MS device.

arm_group.description: patients newly diagnosed with lung cancer by tissue biopsy and did not receive any treatment aiming at the tumor, including chemotherapy and radiotherapy.
Patients diagnosed with pulmonary benign diseases.
Patients without any pulmonary abnormal symptoms or diseases

study_pop.textblock: Patients diagnosed with lung disease or healthy controls without lung diseases， and can cooperate with the collection of exhaled breath.
